resources.string:
To proceed to the next screen, you need to connect your watch to this app. Just press and hold the lower-left button on the watch for 3 seconds. After the second double-beep, the app will display the time-setting screen.

Make sure the G-SHOCK Connected app is not running, as it will interfere with this app.

To run Actions defined in the Actions screen, short-press the lower-right button. Actions are apps on your phone, like Take a photo. Using actions, the watch acts like a remote control for your phone.

The B5600/B5000 watches have 5 alarms and a "signal" (hourly chime) settings shown here. The alarms can be updated by pressing on the time value of each alarm. A new dialog will appear, which allows you to set the alarm\'s time. Once the alarms have been set, you can send them to the watch, or send them to the Alarm Clock app on the phone.

This screen displays Events from your Google Calendar and allows you to send them to the watch\'s reminders.\n\nIf no events appear, make sure you have future events, or non-expired repeating events in your Google calender. Also, make sure you have set your phone to auto-sync to your Google account.
The selected actions are run when the user short-presses the lower-right watch button from the initial screen. With these actions, the watch acts as a remote control for your phone.

The auto-fill values are derived as follows:
  • Time/Date format and Language, are obtained from the Phone\'s setting.
  • Button tone is turned OFF if the phone is in DnD mode, ON otherwise.
  • Power Saving will be set to ON if the battery\'s level is at 15% or less.
    • Note: The values will not change until sent again, even if the conditions change (i.e DnD is turned ON/OFF)

Home Time lets you set a specific time zone and have the watch adjust accordingly when synced with Atomic Clocks. When the app sets the watch\'s time (either manually or automatically), it will automatically syncs Home Time with the current time zone as well. This eliminates the need for swapping your World Time and Home Time.
